result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamont Laverne Louis Keith Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lamont Laverne Louis Keith Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lamont Laverne Louis Keith Jr was found guilty of Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Maintain Absolute Sobriety; comply with random UAs.
AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court sets restitution at zero.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamont Laverne Louis Keith Jr

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Attorney Colin McGinn

Defendant Lamont Laverne Louis Keith Jr in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Lamont Laverne Louis Keith Jr.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 YEARS, credit for 23 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
- 90 days condition time to be used at the discretion of the agent, with Huber for work and childcare.
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety; comply with random UAs.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Cooperate with agent.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Maintain employment.
- No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
- Complete 50 hours of community service.

- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court sets restitution at zero.
*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program 
*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Lamont Laverne Louis Keith in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in person.  Defendant Lamont Laverne Louis Keith in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lamont Laverne Louis Keith in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Defendant Lamont Laverne Louis Keith in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lamont Laverne Louis Keith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
